unnormalised: In a shocking turn of events, Rakesh Kumar, a resident of Karol Bagh, Delhi, was arrested on 12/07/2024 in connection to a case of alleged fraud amounting to Rs. 50 lakhs. The Delhi Police, acting on a tip-off, apprehended Kumar from his residence at H.No. 12, Block C, Karol Bagh.
normalised: In a shocking turn of events, Rakesh Kumar, a resident of Karol Bagh, Delhi, was arrested on twelfth july two thousand and twenty four in connection to a case of alleged fraud amounting to rupee fifty lakhs. The Delhi Police, acting on a tip-off, apprehended Kumar from his residence at House Number twelve, Block C, Karol Bagh.

unnormalised: According to initial reports, Kumar is accused of defrauding several investors through a Ponzi scheme. The FIR, registered under IPC Sections 420 and 406, alleges that he promised high returns within a short period, luring in unsuspecting individuals. Adv. Meena Sharma, representing some of the victims, stated that "the scale of the fraud could be even larger than initially estimated." The case is now under investigation by the Economic Offences Wing (EOW).
normalised: According to initial reports, Kumar is accused of defrauding several investors through a Ponzi scheme. The F-I-R, registered under I-P-C Sections four hundred and twenty and four hundred and six, alleges that he promised high returns within a short period, luring in unsuspecting individuals. Advocate Meena Sharma, representing some of the victims, stated that "the scale of the fraud could be even larger than initially estimated." The case is now under investigation by the Economic Offences Wing (E-O-W).

unnormalised: Kumar was produced before the Tis Hazari Court on 13/07/2024 and remanded to police custody for 7 days. The police are currently tracking down other individuals involved in the scam and are appealing to the public to come forward with any information they may have regarding the case. The next hearing is scheduled for 20/07/2024.
normalised: Kumar was produced before the Tis Hazari Court on thirteenth july two thousand and twenty four and remanded to police custody for seven days. The police are currently tracking down other individuals involved in the scam and are appealing to the public to come forward with any information they may have regarding the case. The next hearing is scheduled for twentieth july two thousand and twenty four.
